citeinfo.title: City of Arlington MA GIS Data

descript.abstract: This polygon dataset represents FEMA flood hazard areas in Arlington, MA.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

theme.themekey: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency

idinfo.accconst: Restricted Access Online: Access is granted to licensee only. Available only to Tufts University affiliates.

cntorgp.cntorg: Arlington MA Maps and Geographic Information Systems

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

procstep.procdesc: Name changed from FEMA_FloodHazardArea to ArlingtonFloodHazard12.

distinfo.distliab: Although this data is being distributed by Tufts University, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the University as to the accuracy of the data and related materials. The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed by the University in the use of this data, or related materials.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: Tufts University. Geographic Information Systems Center

attr.attrdef: Flood Zone. This is the flood insurance risk zone designation. These zones are used by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to designate Special Flood Hazard Areas (SFHAs) and for insurance rating purposes.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

edom.edomvd: Areas with a 1% annual chance of flooding and a 26% chance of flooding over the life of a 30-year mortgage. Because detailed analyses are not performed for such areas; no depths or base flood elevations are shown within these zones.
edom.edomvds: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

edom.edomvd: The base floodplain where base flood elevations are provided. AE Zones are now used on new format FIRMs instead of A1-A30 Zones.
edom.edomvds: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Floodway Type. Floodway areas are designated by the Federal Emergency Management Agency to provide an area that must be kept free of encroachment so that the 1-percent-annual-chance flood event can be carried without substantial increase in flood heights. Normal floodway areas are 'floodway'. Special cases will have a note on the hardcopy Flood Insurance Rate Map.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Special Flood Hazard Area. If the area is within SFHA this field would be True. This field will be true for any area that is coded for any A or V zone flood areas. It should be false for any X or D zone flood areas. Enter "T" for true or "F" for false.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

edom.edomvds: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Static Base Flood Elevation. For areas of constant Base Flood Elevation (BFE), the BFE value is shown beneath the zone label rather than on a BFE line. In this situation the same BFE applies to the entire polygon. This is normally occurs in lakes or coastal zones. This field is only populated where a static BFE is shown on the FIRM.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Vertical Datum. The vertical datum indicates the reference surface from which the flood elevations are measured. Normally this would be North American Vertical Datum of 1988 for new studies. This field is only populated if the STATIC_BFE field is populated. Acceptable values for this field are listed in the D_V_Datum table.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Depth Value for Zone AO Areas. This is shown beneath the zone label on the FIRM. This field is only populated if a depth is shown on the FIRM.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Length Units. This unit indicates the measurement system used for the BFEs and/or depths. Normally this would be feet. This field is only populated if the STATIC_BFE or DEPTH field is populated. Acceptable values for this field are listed in the D_Length_Units table.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Velocity Measurement. This is shown beneath the zone label on the FIRM for alluvial fan areas (certain Zone AO areas). This value represents the velocity of the flood flow in this area. This field is only populated when a velocity is shown on the FIRM.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Unit of Measurement for the Velocity Attribute. This is shown in the legend where alluvial fans are present. This field is only populated if the VELOCITY field is populated. Acceptable values for this field are listed in the D_Velocity_Units table.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: If the area is Zone AR, this field would hold the zone that the area would revert to if the AR zone were removed. This field is only populated if the corresponding area is Zone AR. Acceptable values for this field are listed in the D_Zone table.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: If Zone is Zone AR, this field would hold the static base flood elevation for the reverted zone. This field is populated when Zone equals AR and the reverted zone has a static BFE.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: If Zone is Zone AR, this field would hold that flood depth for the reverted zone. This field is populated when Zone equals AR and the reverted zone has a depth assigned.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Source Citation. Abbreviation used in the metadata file when describing the source information for the S_Fld_Haz_Ar table. Normally, the flood hazard area polygon will be divided to distinguish areas modified by the most recent revision from areas based on the effective FIRM prior to the most recent revision. Revisions and sources prior to the most recent revision will not be tracked for individual polygons in the flood hazard areas table in the standard database.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Federal Emergency Management Agency.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in square feet

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000
